word: But Christ has overcome in our behalf. He was the only one who could be a competent Saviour. He had divine wisdom, ability, and power. He could stand before the world as a wonderful Counsellor, the mighty God, the Everlasting Father, the Prince of Peace.--Letter 7, Jan. 25, 1900, to W. K. Kellogg, brother of and assistant to Dr. J. H. Kellogg.
